channel.title: BBC News - Wales

item.title: Afghanistan: First refugees arrive in Wales after Taliban coup
item.description: Those arriving in the country have directly supported Welsh-based armed forces in Afghanistan.

item.title: Twin Town: Premiere of follow-up to cult film shot only on phones
item.description: Rhys Ifans and Dougray Scott star in new romantic comedy and 'companion piece' to cult Brit flick.

item.title: Covid in Wales: Private PCR travel tests allowed in some cases
item.description: Travellers can use private Covid tests if unable to get approved ones in time, Welsh ministers say.

item.title: Covid: Cwm Taf Morgannwg health board bans visitors due to case rise
item.description: People are asked not to visit hospitals in Bridgend, Rhondda Cynon Taf and Merthyr Tydfil.

item.title: University of South Wales: Hacker jailed for selling exam answers
item.description: Hayder Aljayyash was sentenced to 20 months after breaking into University of South Wales' systems.

item.title: Ant and Dec win at NTAs after I'm A Celeb in Wales
item.description: The duo have won the TV presenting prize at the National Television Awards every year since 2001.

item.title: South Wales Police worker arrested after fatal Cyprus crash
item.description: Christopher Browning was arrested following an accident near Esentepe, north Cyprus.

item.title: Covid: Boosters not needed for all, says Oxford jab creator
item.description: Prof Dame Sarah Gilbert says immunity from two doses of a Covid vaccine is "lasting well".

item.title: Probe after Covid-positive Anglesey carers allowed to work
item.description: Health Minister Eluned Morgan said "it is not a situation that is acceptable".

item.title: Lynette White murder: Cardiff Five are victims, chief says
item.description: Five men spent time in prison when they were wrongly accused of killing Lynette White in 1988.

item.title: Snowdonia: Man rescued from gorge after 80ft fall
item.description: He was reported missing and a team used abseiling equipment to rescue him from below a waterfall.

item.title: Endometriosis: 'I thought I would die from period blood loss'
item.description: Anna Cooper was told was nothing wrong but has now had 13 surgeries due to endometriosis.

item.title: Climbing: All-women Pinnacle Club celebrates its centenary
item.description: An all-women club for climbers marks its centenary where it began - in Snowdonia.

item.title: Lynette White murder: Man falsely accused relives 'nightmare'
item.description: Five men spent time in prison after being wrongly accused of killing Lynette White in 1988.

item.title: Pontypridd market street food Michelin-star chefs for food gong
item.description: Janet Wei beat some chefs who worked in Michelin-star restaurants to claim the title.

item.title: Rare angelshark filmed in Welsh waters 'for first time'
item.description: Angelsharks are an endangered species but the young spotting proves they are breeding in the UK

item.title: Dementia in dogs 'heartbreaking', says Wrexham woman
item.description: Staffie cross Poppy is one of the 10% of dogs with dementia who get a diagnosis.

item.title: World Cup of Darts: Wales' Gerwyn Price and Jonny Clayton beat Finland in round one
item.description: Gerwyn Price and Jonny Clayton make a successful start to their World Cup of Darts defence with a 5-2 victory over Finland in Jena, Germany.

item.title: Late drama as Scarlets win 29-24 in warm-up at Leicester
item.description: Scarlets continue their build-up to the start of the inaugural United Rugby Championship with a dramatic 29-24 win at Leicester Tigers.

item.title: Gareth Anscombe: Wales and Ospreys fly-half to return from two-year injury
item.description: Wales outside-half Gareth Anscombe will finally return after his 25-month knee injury in Ospreys' pre-season friendly at Northampton on Friday.

item.title: Hannah Cain: Leicester forward switches from England to Wales
item.description: Wales manager Gemma Grainger includes Leicester City's Hannah Cain as she names a strong 26-player squad to begin World Cup qualifying.

item.title: 2022 World Cup in Qatar: Wales' various qualification routes explained
item.description: With Wales halfway through their World Cup qualifying campaign, BBC Sport Wales examines their various routes to Qatar.

item.title: Ffoaduriaid cyntaf o Afghanistan yn cyrraedd Cymru
item.description: Mae llawer wedi rhoi cefnogaeth uniongyrchol i unedau'r lluoedd arfog Cymreig yn eu mamwlad ers 2001.

item.title: Ysgol feddygaeth lawn yn y gogledd 'gam yn nes'
item.description: Bydd modd dilyn cwrs meddygaeth llawn ym Mangor o'r flwyddyn nesaf ymlaen, yn ôl y Gweinidog Iechyd.

item.title: Cau traphont 'eiconig' Fictoraidd ar gyfer gwaith £30m
item.description: Dros 1,000 o ddarnau o draphont Y Bermo i gael eu hadnewyddu fel rhan o'r gwaith uwchraddio mwyaf yn ei hanes.

item.title: Sut mae cynaeafu mêl?
item.description: Carys Edwards o Ganllwyd sy'n ein tywys trwy'r broses.

item.title: Cyhoeddi carfan gref i ddechrau ymgyrch Cwpan y Byd 2023
item.description: Mae Hannah Cain wedi'i chynnwys am y tro cyntaf ar ôl penderfynu cynrychioli Cymru'n hytrach na Lloegr.
